q: Get mad, then get over it.
h:
“Get mad, then get over it.” —
Colin Powell

q: Take time like the river that never grows stale. Keep going and steady. No hurry, no rush.
h:
“Take time like the river that never grows stale. Keep going and steady. No hurry, no rush.” —
Rumi

q: Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.
h:
“Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.” —
John Wooden

q: There is little success where there is little laughter.
h:
“There is little success where there is little laughter.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend.
h:
“Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: The less you talk about your shame, the more of it you have.
h:
“The less you talk about your shame, the more of it you have.” —
Mark Manson

q: When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.
h:
“When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.
h:
“Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
h:
“We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Bloom where you are planted!
h:
“Bloom where you are planted!” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: When we have our body and mind in order, everything else will exist in the right place, in the right way.
h:
“When we have our body and mind in order, everything else will exist in the right place, in the right way.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
h:
“Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.” —
Winston Churchill

q: No one returns from a long journey the same person they were before.
h:
“No one returns from a long journey the same person they were before.” —
Zen Proverb

q: It's the little things done consistently over time, straight from your heart, that have the greatest impact.
h:
“It's the little things done consistently over time, straight from your heart, that have the greatest impact.” —
Unknown

q: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
h:
“Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
h:
“Nothing good ever comes of violence.” —
Martin Luther

q: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
h:
“Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
h:
“You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
h:
“Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.” —
John Wooden

q: Life has the name of life, but in reality it is death.
h:
“Life has the name of life, but in reality it is death.” —
Heraclitus

q: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.
h:
“Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.” —
Buddha

q: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
h:
“I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
h:
“Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.” —
Zen Proverb

q: If you want something you've never had you must be willing to do something you've never done.
h:
“If you want something you've never had you must be willing to do something you've never done.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
h:
“We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.
h:
“It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
h:
“Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.” —
Unknown

q: If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.
h:
“If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
h:
“Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.
h:
“Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
h:
“You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!” —
John Lennon

q: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
h:
“If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: You are what you believe yourself to be.
h:
“You are what you believe yourself to be.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
h:
“As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.” —
James Allen

q: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
h:
“The wise warrior avoids the battle.” —
Sun Tzu

q: There is no path to Love. Love is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Love. Love is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
h:
“Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
h:
“A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.” —
Charles Darwin

q: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
h:
“The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.
h:
“If I cannot do great things. I can do small things in a great way.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
h:
“Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
h:
“When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: An un-examined life is not worth living.
h:
“An un-examined life is not worth living.” —
Socrates

q: Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.
h:
“Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
h:
“From error to error one discovers the entire truth.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece
h:
“Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece” —
John Wooden
